title: Christmas Special II: A Jackson White House Christmas
description:
“Now let’s see how Santa Claus will treat you, Mr. Uncle Jackson, President of all these United States!” 
This is the story of Christmas at the Jackson White House in 1835. Andrew’s going (as he often does) to visit a local Washington DC orphanage. He’s giving out gifts like the skinniest Santa you’ve ever seen. Then it’s back to the White House, where: six young Jackson/Donelson children are hoping Santa will come; VP Martin Van Buren is gladly embarrassing himself playing with the children; and the White House is seeing its first Children’s Christmas party! Oh, sorry, “frolic.” You’ll never see a softer side of Old Hickory. You’re welcome, and Merry Christmas!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
